title: The Merger
description: Jan informs Michael that the Scanton branch of Dunder Mifflin will be merging with the Stamford Branch. Jim and Pam are reunited while the other employees of both branches must adjust to their new co-workers.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: The Stamford branch is closing and everybody's just packing up their stuff. Andy Bernard made these tasteful hats.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [to office worker] That's the other thing you got to watch out...  [to Jim] Yo! Tuna! I wanna talk to you about this new boss, Michael Scott.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: So what's he like? Likes? Dislikes? Favorite sports? Favorite movies? Favorite men's magazines?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You know what? I think you just need to meet him.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Playing your cards close to the vest. I get it. Good luck over there, Tuna. Cross me and I will destroy you.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: This is going to be an adventure.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yes. This is going to be very interesting. All right, I'm out of here. See you later?

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Right on. [to Andy] Hey is that Josh's computer?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [scoffs] I could beat that on a skateboard.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yeah, well my feet don't. And I can still crush that time.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Really, Dwight? How fast are you?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Let's just put it this way. Last weekend I outran a black pepper snake.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I am fast. To give you a reference point. I'm somewhere between a snake and a mongoose. And a panther.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Man, what is taking Toby so long?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, I'll just time him later.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Am I being mean to Dwight? I don't know. I did just make him run around the building and I have no intention of timing him. This isn't even a stopwatch. It's a digital thermometer. He does make my life harder, sometimes. And on purpose. Like he tried to put meters on the bathroom stalls as a way of bringing in more money for the company. [yells to Dwight] Hey, three more laps to go. Gotta pick it up if you're going to beat Toby.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I should probably get back to work.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Karen Filip... [In Italian voice] Ka-ren Fili-pell-li.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: My branch is absorbing the Stamford branch. Or, as I like to put it, my family is doubling in size. That's all I'm going to say about it because I have a gigantic performance ahead of me. And I have to get into my head and focus. [exhales]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I'm not firing somebody on the first day.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No, no, no! Not somebody. Gardner.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: The Japanese camp guards of World War II always chose one man to kill whenever a batch of new prisoners arrived. I always wondered how they chose the man who was to die. I think I would have been good at choosing the person.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Got the food? Good! Looky-looky-looky. What I want you to do... set it up in the conference room, please. Make it look nice. As if you are trying to impress a much older man who's way out of your league.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yes! I'm in a good mood today! I'm excited to meet all the new people and to see my old friend again, definitely. That's always a thing that makes people happy... to have an old friend back.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ah! Ding-ding-ding-ding-ding. Our first arrival. Welcome to Scranton. This is Hannah Smoterich-Barr.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Welcome to our humble abode. Follow me to your desk. Your ball and chain is right over here.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You know for a lot of these people this is the only family they have. So...  As far as I'm concerned, [holds up WORLD'S BEST BOSS mug] this says 'World's Best Dad'.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ah! There he is Tony... what's your last name?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Gardner! I knew that. There you go. Gift bag... for you. [laughs] Okay.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Michael, I didn't get a gift bag.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, they're just for guests. If there are any left over, you can buy one later.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Wh..and coupons... to various hot spots around Scranton. [to Tony] All right! Let me show you to your area, sir. Come on, big guy.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, thanks. My Mom made it for me.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Really? That's so cool. I've always wanted to learn...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Welcome, welcome, welcome! [in robot voice] Take me to your leader. Oh wait, I am your leader.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Uh wait, are you a robot or a Martian?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Mmm... dah. I am actually your boss, Michael Scott. Welcome. Wow! You are very exotic looking. Was your dad a G.I. or uh?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I'll be the Number Two guy here in Scranton in six weeks. How? Name repetition, personality mirroring, and never breaking off a handshake. I'm always thinking one step ahead. Like a carpenter that makes stairs.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ah! You must be Andy Bernard. Aloha and welcome!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: And you must be Michael Scott. Aloha and... hello.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: A-ha-ha-ho. Very good! Welcome to our little kingdom. Ah, we have a bag of nifty gifties for you.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Michael, thank you for welcoming me to your little kingdom, Mike.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: They are nifty! They're nifty gifties.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You know who I really like? Is this guy Andy Bernard. He has got this very likable way about him.

quotes.speaker: Martin
quotes.text: ...which is why they need a passing game.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [to Jim] No way. Get him out of here. We don't want any of this kind in here. Good to see you, man.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [to Martin] How are you? Martin Nash, I presume? This is a little gift bag for you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Free of charge. Follow me, I will show you where all the slaves work. [shakes head] Not... so, your desk is...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hi, I'm Jim. I'm new here.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh my god! It's really you!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah, I was just doing a little joke there about how we'd never met...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Awesome! Good to be back. The place looks really good.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: It's really good to see you.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Where do I stand with Pam? Um... no idea. I mean, we're friends. Always have been friends. Um... .that is where we stand.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Well, well, well. Look what the cat dragged in from Stamford.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Fact - I am older. I am wiser. Do not mess with me.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I don't know what you're talking about.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I have a smudge on my forehead?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Why are you looking at my forehead?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey! How are you man? Good to see... you.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I'm good! How are you? So...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, I'm sorry. Are you sitting here now?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Um... unless you really, really want it back.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You know, man, it's really you're call.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [whispers] Let me get that for you.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Yeah. Jim is a nice guy. That's why I got the desk.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Hey, this came with the Stamford book. [Sets down box that says: Personnel Files Stamford CT Office Confidential] Can you take care of it?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: In general, they do not give me much responsibility. But they do let me shred the company documents. And that is really all I need.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Michael Scott. Thank you. I appreciate it, Mike.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hello. I don't believe we've been introduced. Dwight Schrute. Assistant Regional Manager.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Andy Bernard. Regional Director in Charge of Sales.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: So you'll be reporting to me, then.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Which on a film set is the highest title there is. Do you know anything about film?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I know everything about film. I've seen over 240 of them.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I just wanted to say hi.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: How are you? Hey. Welcome back. [puts out fist to bump]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh. Is that like your new thing?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: No, it's nothing. We'll just... [shakes hand]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: All right. Good to be back.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: All right... sorry... sorry about that.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: This thing is so awesome. It will shred anything. Ooh! It will shred a CD. It will shred... a credit card. It will shred... oh! [whispers] Shoot.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [talking to himself] I present the orientation video.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Which is higher? Assistant Regional Manager or Regional Director in Charge of Sales?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I told you the titles are irrelevant. They just relate to pay scale.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Okay. So who gets paid more? Me or Andy?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It is not a matter of more or less. Your pay is just different. Okay? All right! Show time, part one.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I don't care! Dwight! You all report to me! That's all that matters! The rest of it just work out amongst yourselves, ok?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Work it out amongst your selves!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Please! I have a company to run. Well, you let me run the company?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Oh! Oh my god! I have so much to tell you!

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Yes! Tom Cruise and Katie Holmes? They had a baby and they named it Suri. And then Brad Pitt and Angelina Jolie? They had a baby, too, and they named it Shiloh. And both babies are amazing!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay. Everybody settled in? Good. Why don't we all proceed in to the conference room? Or, should I say, the banquet hall. For... drum roll, please [makes drum roll noises], the official Merger Day All-Family Welcome Breakfast. Come on in!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Nope. Um... for the guests it is. For you, consider it cow-meat. Strictly taboo.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, then... consider it poisoned beef. No touchy.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, it's not beef... just... sit down, please. [talks to group] Welcome. Help yourself.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Um... You might want these orientation materials.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Wrong. Toby, this is an orientation not a borientation.[talks to group] Okay. Do not worry. All of your questions are about to be answered. Cell phones and pagers off, please.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Let's face it. Moving to a new job can be very stressful. So I have made an orientation video especially for you newcomers. But it's not like any orientation video that any of you have ever seen. It's funny. It's got a little bit of a zing to it and I hope that it gives you a flavor of what we're all about here at Dunder Mifflin. And what we're all about here in Scranton. So let's just all laugh together and watch "Lazy Scranton".

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Sittin' in my office with a plate of grilled bacon, call my man Dwight just to see what was shakin'.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yo Mike, our town is dope and pretty.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So check out how we live

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: The Electric City. Call poison control if you're bit by a spider.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: But check that it's covered by your health care provider!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: It reminds me of the orientation video showed on my first day. 'The Scranton Witch Project'.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [in video] I am so scared... when people don't label their personal food.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You like coal mines and you wanna see 'em, Well, check it out, yo, the Anthracite Museum! Plenty of space in the parking lot,

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: But the little cars go in the compact spot

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [on video in background] Spot. Scranton. What? The Electric City. Scranton.What? The Electric City. Scranton. What?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, so far, I think it is killin'. I thought it would either be an 'A' or an 'A+' but I completely forgot that there's an 'A++'.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: [recording phone message] This is Karen Filippelli. Please leave a message.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: [recording] This is Karen Filippelli. Please leave a message.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Not bad, but you are Italian so... try it more Italian.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: [recording] [in bad Italian accent] Dis is Kar-en Fill-uh-pel-li. Please leava me da message. A bon danza.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Hey, buddy. Anything new to report?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Do you mean to me? From you? Cause that's how it works.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Am I trying to get under his skin? Yes. Because the angrier he gets, the more marginalized he becomes. Meanwhile, Andy Bernard is out there layin' on the charm.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Hey, Angela. Check this out. It's my new screen saver.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Thank you. You have such a pretty smile by the way.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh yeah. I'm trying to move away from that. Getting into more of a bottled water phase.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: So when do I get to hear everything? Are you still getting unpacked or... you want to grab a coffee or something after work?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh! Um... tonight, actually? No. I'm uh just still getting settled.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, yeah, no! You know. Whenever.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Nope. You're not interrupting anything. Nope. I'm...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: All right. [to Pam] I should probably get back to work. Get back to work.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: The day's going fine. It's been a little chaotic but it's fine. It's great! A lot of distractions. But, it's good.

quotes.speaker: Hannah
quotes.text: [using breast pump] Take a picture. It'll last longer.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I'm sorry. It's just, it's a little distracting.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What is that? A squid's eye or...

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Right place at the right time.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Must be an... air freshener plugged in somewhere. It smells like a funeral home.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Oh, I'll help you find it.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: I... I... I, uh, think I'm just allergic to your perfume.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: It's just my crazy nose. I'm... uh, used to different smells.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Bob Vance bought this perfume for me in Metropolitan Orlando. It's made from real pine.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: You have a lot to learn about this town, sweetie.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: I don't know who these new people think they are. I've sat downwind of Phyllis' stinky perfumes for years. Never said a word.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: People hate people that are different from them. That's natural. But you know what makes people forget their differences?  A great show. That is why I created the 'Integration Celebration'. This is the moment when Scranton and Stamford come together as one. United in applause.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I know what a lot of you must be thinking. 'Wow! What a day! Feels more like a night at a party than a day at work.' Well, in my opinion, business should feel like a night out. A night... at... the Roxbury. Okay. There's supposed to be music and it's... I got it, I got it! I got it. Dwight! Just.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [sings drum beat intro to 'What is Love?']

quotes.speaker: {Andy} & {Michael}
quotes.text: Don't hurt me! Baby, don't hurt me!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You me? You me? Me you? You! You! You me! Bow Bow Bow!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You me? You me? Me you me! You! You! You me you! You! Oh my nose so itchy, why's my nose so itchy!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Oh, probably because of all the nose candy.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [laughs hysterically] Okay, I told you these guys had a sense of humor.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: All right, all right, I'm on a roll.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Why are the new people on the table? To show them that we are not above them.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Not today. No. Tony! Please join your cohorts on the table if you would.

quotes.speaker: Tony
quotes.text: Uh... this is difficult, for me.

quotes.speaker: Tony
quotes.text: No. I mean I can't physically. I can't get on the table.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, well. Just use the momentum of your lower half to hoist yourself up.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You know what? I'll help. I will...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Don't be shy! Dwight! Let's do this!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Come on. We're doing this thing! Let's get up.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Bend at the knees. Okay, here we go. Here we go. I'm under this... I'm under this hock here. I don't know what I'm grabbing here.

quotes.speaker: Tony
quotes.text: All right. All right. Stop. Put me down.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: We've almost got it. Push it! Push it!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You've got it, you've got it.

quotes.speaker: Tony
quotes.text: PUT ME DOWN RIGHT NOW or else!

quotes.speaker: Tony
quotes.text: It's just not going to work for me.

quotes.speaker: Tony
quotes.text: I was on the fence about this and... it's just not a good fit.

quotes.speaker: Tony
quotes.text: I can't work here. I have to quit.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You can't quit! On the first day. That's [deep voice] heresy, my friend! [regular voice] Okay, let's talk about this. What happened? I mean, what... Was it Toby? Did he say something? Cause he's... what?

quotes.speaker: Tony
quotes.text: No. Toby was helpful. He was very kind. It's just your management style.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: My management style? So... didn't you think 'Lazy Scranton' was funny?

quotes.speaker: Tony
quotes.text: No. Was it supposed to be funny?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay. Well, don't bother quitting because you're fired.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You are fired! I'm sorry, but we don't have quitters on this team! Just clean out your desk!

quotes.speaker: Tony
quotes.text: But there's nothing in my desk except coupons.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Don't try to apologize to me, man! It's too late. Just get out! Take your bad vibes with you.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: That was my advice. Remember? I'm the one who suggested that you fire him.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Probably the best advice you ever gave me, Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: And what advice has Andy given to you today that you have acted on? Would 'none' be an accurate estimate? None advice? [whispers] Fire Andy. Fire. Andy.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Dwight may have won the battle. But I will win... the next battle.

quotes.speaker: Hannah
quotes.text: Tony was right. This environment is dysfunctional.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Maybe that's because some people treat it like their own private Hooters strip club.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Whoa, Angela! Hold on. Hooters is a restaurant. With over 400 locations worldwide.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Back to work. We don't have to get along. We just have to work together.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No. We do have to get along. Can't we all just get along? Or have we forgotten the words of the Reverend King.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: The word merger comes from the word marriage. And that was what today was supposed to be. The loving union between people. Instead, it has become like when my Mom moved in with Jeff. And once again, it becomes my job to fix it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey! Hey, everybody! Something happened! Those guys from Vance Refrigeration, they let the air out of our tires.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah! They punk'd us! They punk'd us good! Come on. Come on!

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Does Bob Vance work for Vance Refrigeration?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Man, they got us so bad. We cannot let them get away with this. We have got to pull together as one and steal their refrigerators.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: I don't... I don't think we can do that.

quotes.speaker: Martin
quotes.text: Hey! Why doesn't your car have a flat tire?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Why? I will tell you why. Because they saved the worst for me. They put a hate note under my windshield wiper. Check this out. It's so hateful. [reads note] "You guys SUCK! You can never pull together as one and revenge us. That is why you SUCK!"

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No. No, no, no. No.  You are falling for it. You're playing right into their hands. This is just what they want you to do. Don't, oh...

quotes.speaker: Martin
quotes.text: [to Stanley] What's up with this guy?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Got an hour? I'll try to explain.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: THIS IS EGREGIOUS! This is egregious!

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Trust me. It only gets worse.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Oh, we find little times during the day.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: How are we going to get home?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Bob Vance has an air pump. He said he'd fill all our tires up.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: See that? Mission accomplished. Like a bunch of fourth graders. Sometimes, what brings the kids together is hating the lunch lady. Although that'll change. Because, by the end of the fourth grade, the lunch lady was actually the person I hung out with the most. [answers phone] Jell-o!

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Did you fire Tony Gardner when he was trying to quit?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I did. Major personnel crises averted. Compliment accepted.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Do you realize, Michael, that we now have to pay him severance?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: But do you realize that that was actually Dwight's idea? Bad advice from my Number Two.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: What? No. No. No, Jim is your Number Two.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: He's the only one  who has worked with both groups. I sent you a memo about this.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes, I know that. For, I do read the memos.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So after a great deal of thought and introspective-shun, I have decided to make Jim my new Number Two.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: If he even wants it. It doesn't come with a pay raise.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: So who will be your new Number Three?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Uh... that I have not decided yet.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Michael, I would just like to say you have handled this entire situation with great aplomb.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Thank you, Andy. That's... very kind. Thanks.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: And I have to say your leadership...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Shut it! That's... [whispers to camera] suck up!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [talking on cellphone] Hey! Where you at, Filippelli?

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: [off camera] I'm at the grocery store buying a corkscrew to give myself a lobotomy.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [laughs] What's wrong? You didn't have a good first day?

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Oh my god! Hey! You want to meet at Cooper's in an hour? I need a drink.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah. Sure. Sounds good. I... . [sees Pam in rearview mirror] Hey! You know what? Can I give you a call right back?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I thought you had already... left.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Uh... no. I just uh had some other stuff I had to do.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, nothing. I just feel bad. I feel like things were a little weird today... or something.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I just think I should tell you that... I've sort of started seeing someone. And uh...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh. That's totally cool. You can do whatever you want.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: We're friends. We'll always be friends.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: It's good to have you back.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Saw your dorkmobile in the parking lot. What does it get, like four miles to the gallon?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Uh, try double that. Classic TransAm, vintage American muscle. Please.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah, my Xterra's pretty sweet. Luxurious, yet rugged. Leave it to the Japanese.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Xterra's not even a real word.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Actually, it is. It's Latin for "earth."

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh, so you drive an X-Earth?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: That makes sense. I'd rather drive a classic TransAm than an XEarth.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah, I bet you would. Oh, by the way, 1985 called. It wants its car back.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Well I hope 1985 has a time machine 'cause I drive an 87.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Oh, speaking of time machines, I just got back from the future and I went to your funeral and, guess what, nobody came.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Speaking of funerals, why don't you go ahead and go die.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Oh, that was a really well constructed sentence. You should be an English professor at Cor-not University.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: If I were an idiot, I'd be driving a TransAm.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: If you were driving a TransAm, you would be the smartest idiot in the whole world.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [coughs sentence] I was making fun of your comeback! That's why it worked. [talks normally to camera] Totally got the best of that interchange.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: And this is, don't tell me, Martin... Ne... Ne...Nack.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Mocha complexion. Supplier relations. Either caught a fish or was standing next to a man who caught a fish in Key West, Florida.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [holds up piece of paper] It wasn't clear on the Google Image search.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Hey, man. Good. Listen, my M&M's are under the desk if you want any.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: [to Angela] It's his first day back.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: His hair's flipping out on the sides.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: This is weird with you facing the other way.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah, I never even knew that part of the office existed. [Pam chuckles] Hey, who's that guy? [Jim points to Stanley]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Seems like a nice enough guy.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [Pam nods head] You should say hi. Use her full name.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Thank you for all of this. This is so helpful. You know what? One last question. Um, who is that fine older gentleman in the corner? [points to Creed]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Uh, that is Creed Bratton. He has four toes and he fought in the Civil war.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: For both sides. Whoever paid more.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Hey, uh sorry. Seriously, can you guys... I'm trying to get some work done.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Sorry. Man. [Pam hesitates and then leaves]

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: [notices Karen has same thermos as herself] Hey. That's funny.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: [holds out flask] Do you want a little?

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Uh no, I'm fine, thank you.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Okay. If you change your mind, you just let me know, okay?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [approaching Kevin to shake hand] Hi, Andy Bernard.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: What's that on your shirt? [points to Andy's shirt]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: That is a penguin. You like it?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Michael, have you met the Penguin?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Ha, that's why I wore this shirt.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey, girls. What's happening? Startinng to blend? Well, before long, you guys keep hanging out, you guys you are gonna share the same menstrual cycle.

quotes.speaker: Martin
quotes.text: [sniffs. Pans to Creed eating his mungbeans.]

quotes.speaker: Hannah
quotes.text: [pushing back desk item] Here you go.

quotes.speaker: Hannah
quotes.text: Yeah, I mean my stuff's coming over, but umm... is this...is this yours? [holds up travel mug]

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Well... I... Hey. You've never met me before.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I know, but you just give off the vide of a guy who's getting thinner.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: You know who I really like? That guy, Andy.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Can't we all get along?  No, we can't. But here's the thing:

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I need somebody to pick a card. [Dwight raises hand] One of the new people, please? Tony? [Tony walks away]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: All right. Good. Thank you. [Andy picks a card] Do not look at your card. Now, I've always said that to be a great salesman is to have the ability to connect with people right here [puts hand over heart]. So to be a great salesman is to be a king of hearts. Turn over your card.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [starts clapping] Very good Michael. Really good. [Michael shushes Dwight]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So I think in order for us all to work together well we must come together as a family and then we can all be [starts to fan out the rest of his cards facing the group showing kings of hearts] a king of hearts.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [clapping] No, no, it's better than fantastic. It's super perfect.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Dwight, don't, don't be a suck up.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What I want all of you [points at Scranton branch] to do is approach one of the new people and tell them the one thing that you like most about them. Who wants to start? Who wants to give it a shot?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay Meredith, let's give it a shot.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: [to Martin] I love your complexion. It's like devil's food cake.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It just goes to show you, you play with fire and you are gonna singe your eyebrows. And they do not grow back the same way. [takes of glasses and points to right eyebrow]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: It is inspiring to me to watch you navigate these murky waters.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: We heard what you said. You didn't cover it at all.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I had a tickle in my throat.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [points at camera] They're gonna have... You can't say that, all right?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [clearing throat noise] Idiot. Dwight's an idiot! Did you catch that or did... did the cough cover it?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [cleaing throat] You're a jerk. Dwight's a jerk!
